item.description:

item.title: Crazy Sub
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

And they would say that while thinking she actually WAS racist, because…?

If you think someone is actually racist (based on what you said happened BEFORE the video), you don’t go saying it ‘jokingly’ after that.

Just like if I thought someone was dumb, I don’t go around saying ‘you are dumb’ and not mean it, its contradictory

Point being… they either thought she actually was being racist, or they thought she wasn’t; on both counts

Though as a teacher she has much worse ways she could be racist, rather than calling security on a student (who cant do anything without a reason) Though like I said, the kids were being disruptive anyways

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Crazy Sub

item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

I didnt use that part of the video as an example of racism, in fact, I avoided that part alltogether because I knew that it wasnt a racial statement.

item.title: Crazy Sub
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Oh come on. Did you even watch the video? The mexican was the main guy talking back, you can hear it when she says ‘they heard me in mexico’, then he’s like “thats racist!”. You guys must have no idea what racism is… but saying a country isn’t racist at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy Sub
item.dc:creator: @Dunder_Mifflin1 Dunder Mifflin
item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

@xryz

She was being racist (dont know the specifics, I wasn’t there that period). And was threatening to call security on the mexican who got in a playful/kidding around fight with another white kid in the class. Even after telling her it was ok she kept insisting on only calling the security on the mexican kid. May I ask why you’re sticking up for her? I understand that at the end the students were VERY disrespectful but I think that was much less then what she deserved.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy Sub
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well I’m at 4:12, few things I’ve noticed:

If we had our phone out at all and a teacher sees it, you get it confiscated until the end of the next day, and your parents need to pick it up.

Skateboards are not allowed on our campus.

Profanity to a teacher gets you sent to the office immediately.

Basically agreeing with xryz. Don’t disrespect adults, especially teachers. I doubt she does this everywhere she goes.

[quote=“Dunder Mifflin, post:5, topic:425607”][quote author=xryz link=topic=528262.msg3852191#msg3852191 date=1324114381]
all i saw was over all disrespect. sure she could have handled things a bit different but wow. speechless about the involved students behavior. probably missing some key stuff b/c i want there nor was it recorded. I hate when my fellow students are disrespectful like that, makes me want to beat their faces in.
[/quote]

She was really bad prior to this, provoking the students to act this way.[/quote]This kinda makes me laugh, that’s obviously what the students think, because they don’t agree with the school rules. And from the way people are acting in the video it supports that. What type of ‘provoking’ do you mean?

And some teachers have rules about substitutes where they elevate everything to a suspension.

I just heard ‘whup ur ass’, so I’m expecting the real part to be coming up…

EDIT - So basically all she did was swear a couple times? The only thing I see is that, and kids overreacting because she’s asking them to leave the room. Which happens all the time here, it’s the easiest punishment or way to get kids to cool off…

Read full topic
